1.text: And Jehovah doth answer Job, and saith:—

2.text: Is the striver with the Mighty instructed? The reprover of God, let him answer it.

3.text: And Job answereth Jehovah, and saith:—

4.text: Lo, I have been vile, What do I return to Thee? My hand I have placed on my mouth.

5.text: Once I have spoken, and I answer not, And twice, and I add not.

6.text: And Jehovah answereth Job out of the whirlwind, and saith:—

7.text: Gird, I pray thee, as a man, thy loins, I ask thee, and cause thou Me to know.

8.text: Dost thou also make void My judgment? Dost thou condemn Me, That thou mayest be righteous?

9.text: And an arm like God hast thou? And with a voice like Him dost thou thunder?

10.text: Put on, I pray thee, excellency and loftiness, Yea, honour and beauty put on.

11.text: Scatter abroad the wrath of thine anger, And see every proud one, and make him low.

12.text: See every proud one—humble him, And tread down the wicked in their place.

13.text: Hide them in the dust together, Their faces bind in secret.

14.text: And even I—I do praise thee, For thy right hand giveth salvation to thee.

15.text: Lo, I pray thee, Behemoth, that I made with thee: Grass as an ox he eateth.

16.text: Lo, I pray thee, his power is in his loins, And his strength in the muscles of his belly.

17.text: He doth bend his tail as a cedar, The sinews of his thighs are wrapped together,

18.text: His bones are tubes of brass, His bones are as a bar of iron.

19.text: He is a beginning of the ways of God, His Maker bringeth nigh his sword;

20.text: For food do mountains bear for him, And all the beasts of the field play there.

21.text: Under shades he lieth down, In a secret place of reed and mire.

22.text: Cover him do shades, with their shadow, Cover him do willows of the brook.

23.text: Lo, a flood oppresseth—he doth not haste, He is confident though Jordan Doth come forth unto his mouth.

24.text: Before his eyes doth one take him, With snares doth one pierce the nose?
